h2. Description

This story covers structured playtesting, iteration tracking, and final documentation for Deliverable 2.

The goal is to demonstrate measurable iteration, clear design adjustments, and traceable development decisions based on testing feedback.

----

h2. Acceptance Criteria

* At least 3 structured playtest sessions OR ≥ 5 documented feedback points.
* Design changes are explicitly tracked (before → change → result).
* Build stability validated via smoke testing checklist.
* Report draft includes required D2 sections (design rationale, iteration evidence, reflection).
* Screenshots / short clip included as supporting evidence.

Design and implement progression systems that create a meaningful reward loop.

Acceptance Criteria:

* At least one progression mechanic implemented (XP, unlock, item reward, or stage-based rewards).
* At least one meaningful reward loop (intrinsic + extrinsic).
* Progress state persists across a session.
* Progression logic documented in report.

Implement and tune core gameplay systems to satisfy D2 rubric requirements.

Acceptance Criteria:

* Resource system implemented (health / energy / currency).
* Risk–reward loop exists and is tunable.
* Difficulty curve is explainable and supported by tuning notes.
* Balancing decisions documented in report.

column1: In-world delivery implementation (dialogue / notes / UI placeholder)
Narrative beats outline (3–5 beats) + placement plan

column32:
*Acceptance Criteria (Checklist)*

* Story beats / lore appear in-world (e.g., environmental text, NPC, UI, or scripted events).
* At least one in-game narrative delivery method exists (dialogue box, notes, cutscene, or placeholder).
* Tone + setting are consistent with the project premise across level visuals + text.
* Evidence is captured (screenshots/video + brief annotation) for the report.

*Evidence to collect*

* Screenshots of at least 3 narrative touchpoints (with short captions).
* 1 short gameplay clip (15–30s) showing narrative delivery in context.
Write the rubric-aligned paragraph(s): what was built, what cues were used, how pacing was handled, and reference evidence.
Capture 3+ screenshots and write 1–2 sentences per screenshot describing the guidance cue.
Adjust spacing, enemy placement, and choke points to avoid dead-end confusion and improve flow.
Implement at least three guidance cues and document where/why each cue is used.

* Greybox main path from start to goal
* Mark intended guidance points (where cues will be placed)
* Ensure the route is completable end-to-end

Goal
Build at least one playable level with clear navigation (start → goal) and intentional pacing.

Scope

* Greybox/blockout of 1 level (core route + optional side path if time permits)
* Player guidance cues embedded in the level
* Evidence captured for D2 report (screenshots + short notes)

Acceptance Criteria (AC)

* [ ] At least 1 playable level exists with a clear navigation flow (start → goal).
* [ ] Player guidance uses 3+ cues (e.g., lighting, signage, camera framing, enemy placement, landmarks).
* [ ] Exploration vs. challenge is intentionally paced (no repeated dead-end confusion).
* [ ] Level has a basic checkpoint/restart behavior that does not break the run.

Evidence to attach

* [ ] 3+ screenshots showing guidance cues and route clarity
* [ ] Short notes: what each cue is + why it works

column1: Fix top P0/P1 bugs from playtest
column32:
*Acceptance Criteria*

* At least 3 P0/P1 bugs are fixed (or all existing P0 fixed, whichever is higher).
* Each fix is verified using the smoke checklist.
* Remaining known issues are logged and prioritized (not hidden).
* Demo run can be completed end-to-end without critical blockers.

*Acceptance Criteria*

* Bug template includes: summary, environment, repro steps, expected vs actual, severity (P0/P1/P2), screenshots/logs.
* Severity definitions are documented (what counts as P0/P1/P2).
* At least 3 sample bugs are created using the template (can be real or mock).

*Acceptance Criteria*

* Checklist includes at least 12 test steps covering start/play/win/fail/restart/pause.
* Each step has expected result written.
* Checklist is reusable for future sprints (saved in Jira issue).
* One full smoke test run is executed and results noted (pass/fail).

*Acceptance Criteria*

* Boss design includes theme + player counterplay concept.
* 3 attack patterns are specified with telegraph + expected player response.
* Patterns are feasible with current mechanics (no new big systems required).
* Spec is written clearly enough that another teammate could implement it.

*Acceptance Criteria*

* Pause freezes gameplay (movement/AI/timers) and shows a pause UI.
* Resume returns to the exact pre-pause state.
* Restart works from both paused and unpaused states.
* No state corruption after pause → restart → start again sequence.

*Acceptance Criteria*

* HUD displays health/status and a simple objective or guidance.
* HUD does not overlap critical gameplay area on common resolutions.
* Values update correctly during gameplay (e.g., after damage/heal).
* HUD can be toggled off/on for debugging (optional but nice).

column1: Add basic feedback (hit, damage, cooldown or equivalent)
Implement playable core loop (start → play → fail/win → restart)
column32:
*Acceptance Criteria*

* Player can start a new run and reach a playable state within 10 seconds.
* A run ends in a clear *Win* or *Fail* state.
* Restart returns the game to a clean initial state (no duplicated entities, no leftover UI, no broken input).
* No soft-lock after 5 consecutive restarts.

* *Goal:* Establish a risk/issue tracking system.
* *Acceptance Criteria:*
*# Create at least *5 risks* in Jira (as separate issues or a documented table).
*# Each risk includes: *Impact*, *Probability*, *Mitigation*, *Owner*, *Due date*.
*# At least 1 risk marked as “active” with a mitigation action item.
*# Weekly review process defined (who checks, when).
Deliver a playable core gameplay loop demo with basic UI and stable restart flow.

* *Goal:* Define project scope and success criteria.
* *Deliverable:* 1-page project charter.
* *Acceptance Criteria:*
*# Charter is 1 page (max 2).
*# Includes *scope*, *out-of-scope*, *assumptions*, *constraints*, and *success criteria*.
*# Reviewed by team and updated based on feedback.
*# Final version linked/attached in Jira.

*Objective*
Stabilize the project through systematic testing, bug triage, and regression checks to ensure demo/readme deliverables are reliable.

*Deliverables*

* Test plan checklist (smoke tests for main flows)
* Bug triage process (severity, priority, owner, due date)
* Regression checklist executed per sprint / before submission
* Known issues list (if any) + mitigation/workarounds
* Final stability pass and demo-ready build

*Acceptance Criteria*

* All P0/P1 bugs (crash, data loss, soft-lock, blocker) are resolved or mitigated
* Smoke test passes: start → play → fail/win → restart; save/load (if in scope)
* Bugs include reproduction steps + expected vs actual + screenshots/logs when relevant
* Weekly bug trend is tracked (created vs resolved) or at minimum “open bug count” is reported
* Final deliverable meets submission/demo requirements

*Dependencies / Risks*

* Dependencies: stable builds from other epics; team availability for testing
* Risks: last-minute integration failures → mitigate by “integration day” tasks + regression checklist; unowned bugs → mitigate by assigning owners

h2. 

*Objective*
Implement reliable persistence for game state and a clean data model to support debugging, balancing, and future extensions.

*Deliverables*

* Save/load workflow defined (when save happens; what is persisted)
* GameState schema documented (fields, versioning approach)
* Implementation of serialization/deserialization (JSON/local storage)
* Data validation + backward compatibility strategy (basic)
* Minimal debug logging for save/load failures

*Acceptance Criteria*

* Game state can be saved and restored without loss of critical progress
* Save files are readable and structured (consistent schema)
* Load handles corrupted/missing data gracefully (fails safely)
* At least 5 test cases documented (fresh start, mid-run save, reload, invalid file, version change)
* Save/load tasks include clear acceptance checks and owners

*Dependencies / Risks*

* Dependencies: finalized list of persistent fields; core loop state machine
* Risks: schema churn → mitigate via version field; data corruption → mitigate via validation + fallback

*Objective*
Deliver a clear, consistent user experience with readable feedback, menus, and accessibility-friendly UI for core interactions.

*Deliverables*

* Main menu + pause/menu flow (start, restart, quit)
* In-game HUD (health/status/objectives as needed)
* Basic settings (volume / keybinds or minimal options)
* UI copy/labels consistency + error states (e.g., invalid action feedback)
* UX checklist (navigation, readability, input responsiveness)

*Acceptance Criteria*

* Player can start a run, pause, resume, and restart without confusion
* HUD communicates critical information with minimal clutter
* UI is functional on target resolution/window mode (no overlap/clipping)
* At least 1 accessibility consideration implemented (e.g., font size/readability, color contrast, remappable keys, subtitles—pick one)
* UI/UX bugs tracked separately from gameplay bugs

*Dependencies / Risks*

* Dependencies: defined game states (menu ↔ gameplay ↔ game over); art assets (placeholder ok)
* Risks: UI scope creep → mitigate by MVP menu + HUD first; inconsistent states → mitigate by documenting UI flow

*Objective*
Build at least one complete level and boss encounter that showcases progression, readability, and difficulty tuning.

*Deliverables*

* Level layout and progression plan (gates/checkpoints/flow)
* Boss design spec (patterns, phases, counters, telegraphs)
* Implementation of boss behaviors + collision/damage rules
* Checkpoint / respawn integration (if applicable)
* Difficulty tuning notes + playtest results

*Acceptance Criteria*

* Level has a clear start → goal path with at least 1 meaningful challenge sequence
* Boss encounter is beatable and repeatable; patterns are learnable (telegraphed)
* At least 1 tuning pass completed based on playtest feedback
* No critical blockers in level flow (spawn, checkpoints, transitions)
* Boss/level tasks are tracked with clear owner + due dates

*Dependencies / Risks*

* Dependencies: core loop stability; art/audio placeholders; save/checkpoint rules
* Risks: over-complex boss → mitigate by MVP pattern set first; integration bugs → mitigate via dedicated test tasks

*Objective*
Deliver a playable core loop that demonstrates the intended player experience (input → action → feedback → progression → repeat).

*Deliverables*

* Core player controls + movement/combat/interactions implemented
* Basic game state loop: start → play → fail/win → restart
* Minimal UI feedback (HP/energy/cooldowns or equivalent)
* Tuning parameters documented (damage, cooldowns, movement speed, etc.)
* Demo build for playtesting + short playtest notes

*Acceptance Criteria*

* Player can complete a full gameplay cycle within 3–5 minutes
* Failure and restart flow is consistent (no soft-locks)
* At least 1 complete encounter (enemy or obstacle) is playable end-to-end
* Key gameplay parameters are configurable (not hard-coded everywhere)
* Playtest feedback captured and at least 3 adjustments logged in Jira

*Dependencies / Risks*

* Dependencies: design decisions on mechanics + basic assets (placeholder ok)
* Risks: scope creep → mitigate by locking MVP loop first; unstable tuning → mitigate via config/tuning doc

*Objective*
Define project scope, success criteria, milestones, and coordination process for CS4483 game development.

*Deliverables*

* Project charter (1-page): scope, assumptions, constraints
* Milestone plan (Sprint goals + key dates)
* Definition of Done (DoD) and acceptance criteria template
* Risk/Issue log baseline + owner assignment
* Communication cadence: weekly status update format + action-item tracking

*Acceptance Criteria*

* Scope statement finalized and approved by team
* Milestones and sprint goals visible in Jira (Backlog/Timeline)
* DoD + acceptance criteria template applied to new Stories/Tasks
* Initial risk log created with at least 5 items (impact/probability/mitigation/owner/due date)

*Dependencies / Risks*

* Dependency: timely input from design/dev/art teammates
* Risk: scope creep → mitigated via DoD + change log
